Text:
You need to use **[`filter()`][1]** which filter elements based the selector. **[`is()`][2]** will return a Boolean value not the jQuery object, returns true at least one element is matched else returns false. $(document).ready(function() { var id = "foo"; alert($("div").filter("#" + id).text()); });
Some text
[1]: http://api.jquery.com/filter/ [2]: http://api.jquery.com/is/

You need to use **[`filter()`][1]** which filter elements based the selector. **[`is()`][2]** will return a Boolean value not the jQuery object, returns true at least one element is matched else returns false. $(document).ready(function() { var id = "foo"; alert($("div").filter("#" + id).text()); });
Some text
Instead you can simply use selector `$("div#" + id)` which select div with that particular id. It will only select element is div. $(document).ready(function() { var id = "foo"; alert($("div#" + id).text()); });
Some text
[1]: http://api.jquery.com/filter/ [2]: http://api.jquery.com/is/
